src.etl_engine module

exception src.etl_engine.AsyncETLException(msg='An exception occurred during an async ETL task', *args, **kwargs)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised during an async ETL task.

class src.etl_engine.ETLEngine(api: ~src.async_peoplesoft_api.AsyncPeopleSoftAPI, api_endpoint: str, oracledb: ~src.oracle_db.OracleDB, oracle_table_owner: str, oracle_table_name: str, worker: ~src.async_worker.AsyncWorker = <src.async_worker.AsyncWorker object>, cache: dict | None = None)

Bases: object

ETL: An ETL object consumes data from an API endpoint, transforms it, and loads it into a database.

Parameters:

  • api (AsyncPeopleSoftAPI) – The API object for data retrieval.

  • api_endpoint (str) – The name of the API endpoint providing the source data (e.g. ‘ps_deduction_class’).

  • oracledb (OracleDB) – The database object for Oracle interactions.

  • oracle_table_owner (str) – The owner of the Oracle target table (e.g. ‘CHIPS_STG’).

  • oracle_table_name (str) – The name of the Oracle target table (e.g. ‘PS_DEDUCTION_CLASS’).

  • worker (AsyncWorker, optional) – The worker for managing async tasks. Defaults to AsyncWorker().

  • cache (dict, optional) – A cache for storing intermediate data. Defaults to None.

async add_records_to_table(endpoint: str, params: dict) → None

Gets items from the endpoint for the specified params and runs etl_task to load them into the associated Oracle table.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint.

  • params (dict) – The request parameters.

Returns:

None

async etl_task(session: ClientSession, endpoint: str, params: dict) → None

Makes a single GET request to the endpoint and returns only the ‘items’ in the response, then transforms and loads the data into Oracle.

Parameters:

  • session (aiohttp.ClientSession) – The aiohttp session.

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint.

  • params (dict) – The request parameters.

Returns:

None

extract(limit: int = 10000, offsets: list[int] | None = None) → DataFrame

Gets data from the API and returns it in a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • limit (int, optional) – The maximum number of records to retrieve. Defaults to 10000.

  • offsets (list[int], optional) – List of offsets for pagination. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the extracted data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Raises:

ExtractException – If an error occurs during extraction.

get_all_failed_request_params(db: OracleDB, endpoint: str, table: str) → None

Gets failed requests for the last run of a table build from the Oracle request log table and retries the full ETL cycle for those requests.

Parameters:

  • db (OracleDB) – The database object for Oracle interactions.

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to check.

  • table (str) – The name of the table.

Returns:

A list of failed request parameters.

Return type:

list

async insert_records_using_params(endpoint: str, list_of_params: list[dict], n_records_per_task: int, n_requests_per_session: int = 500) → None

Requests records for each param in list_of_params and loads the records into the associated table in Oracle.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint.

  • list_of_params (list[dict]) – List of parameters for each request.

  • n_records_per_task (int) – Number of records to fetch per task.

  • n_requests_per_session (int, optional) – Number of requests per session. Defaults to 500.

Returns:

None

load(transformed_data: DataFrame, truncate_first: bool = True) → None

Loads data into the database.

Parameters:

  • transformed_data (pd.DataFrame) – The transformed data to be loaded into the database.

  • truncate_first (bool, optional) – If True, truncates the table before loading. Defaults to True.

Raises:

LoadException – If an error occurs during loading.

async rebuild_table_using_pagination(endpoint: str, n_records_per_task: int, n_requests_per_session: int = 500) → None

Runs all ETL iterations to load all the data from an endpoint to a table. Opens a new session every n_requests_per_session and creates pages based on the total number of records at the endpoint at the time of execution and the record limit per request.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint.

  • n_records_per_task (int) – Number of records to fetch per task.

  • n_requests_per_session (int, optional) – Number of requests per session. Defaults to 500.

Returns:

None

async rebuild_table_using_params(endpoint: str, list_of_params: list[dict], n_records_per_task: int, n_requests_per_session: int = 500) → None

Runs all ETL iterations to load all the data from an endpoint to a table. Opens a new session every n_requests_per_session and processes each set of params.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint.

  • list_of_params (list[dict]) – List of parameters for each request.

  • n_records_per_task (int) – Number of records to fetch per task.

  • n_requests_per_session (int, optional) – Number of requests per session. Defaults to 500.

Returns:

None

async rerun_etl_for_failed_requests(endpoint: str) → None

After at least one run of the ETL is complete, get the requests that failed and re-run them. This function iteratively attempts to process any remaining failed requests.

Parameters:

endpoint (str) – The API endpoint.

Returns:

None

transform(extracted_data: DataFrame) → DataFrame

Transforms the extracted data.

Parameters:

extracted_data (pd.DataFrame) – The extracted data.

Returns:

The transformed data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Raises:

TransformException – If an error occurs during transformation.

Properties created:

self.data_model_discrepancies: Data model discrepancies between the API data and the Oracle data. self.data_model_consistencies: Data model consistencies between the API data and the Oracle data. self.transformed_data: The transformed data for further operations.
